byline.original: By Elisabeth Rosenthal; Elisabeth Rosenthal is an emergency-room physician in New York City

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: AT THE HUMAN AND BEHAVIOR GENETICS Laboratory at Emory University, in Atlanta, a videotape recording shows a smiling 8-year-old girl peering from behind thick glasses at two clear plastic boxes topped by red bows, each containing a chocolate-chip cookie. The game, a psychologist explains, is to open both boxes and remove the cookies - and no eating until both cookies are out.

headline.main: Study Sees Multiple Benefits in Certain Fats

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Mono-unsaturated fats like olive oil may benefit the heart not only by lowering cholesterol but also by reducing blood pressure and blood sugar, a study in Italy has suggested.
docs.snippet: LEAD: Mono-unsaturated fats like olive oil may benefit the heart not only by lowering cholesterol but also by reducing blood pressure and blood sugar, a study in Italy has suggested.
